text: The banner that strikes fear in the hearths of those unlucky to live in one of the many coastal villages of the empire, Grand Cathay or even Ulthuan. Where it goes carnage and destruction follows. Norscans from many tribes, yet especially those from the Graeling tribe would kill, mane and ravage for a chance to wield it in to battle.
Some flames? Some muscles? Not so useful when you're sleeping on the ocean floor, Valbrand.

It’s origins unclear, yet no one questions the power of the Dragonblade. Bestowed upon Valbrand by the lesser god Suthrond it holds both magical and daemonic properties. In chronicles it is said to be the size of a small ship, where other sources claim it weighs heavier than atleast a dozen men. It’s the source of Valbrand’s power, as it does not only make him a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield, it also inspires wandering norscans to join his cause as they view his sword proof of Valbrand’s status as a favoured of Khorne.
